VIII. Communications and Reports from Other City Officers
1. COF 2019 #33 : A communication was received from City Clerk Donna P. Lopez, transmitting a communication from Councillor Mallon, transmitting notes for the meeting of the Mayor's Arts Task Force held on May 9, 2019. PLACED ON FILE
a. Cover letter request 5-16
Appended Information
Awaiting Report List
1. AR-16-26 : Report on the possibility of the City Council implementing a zoning change, on the permitting of all new restaurants where a wood-fired oven is used as a significant method of food preparation. On a communication from Councillor Kelley requesting that this matter be forwarded to the 2018-2019 Legislative Session.
2. AR-16-42 : Report on plans for the former Riverside Community Health Center on Western Avenue, including transfer of ownership of the building to the City and the process for determining future usage. On a communication from Councillor Kelley requesting that this matter be forwarded to the 2018-2019 Legislative Session.
3. AR-16-83 : Report on drafting possible legislation and other recommendations for interim actions to identify and address the public health impacts of any commercial wood-fired ovens. On a communication from Councillor Kelley requesting that this matter be forwarded to the 2018-2019 Legislative Session.
4. AR-16-101 : Report on the potential of building below market rental housing on City-owned parking lots along Bishop Allen Drive. On a communication from Councillor McGovern requesting that this matter be forwarded to the 2018-2019 Legislative Session.
5. AR-16-108 : Report on whether people displaced and qualify for Emergency Status who are using Section 8 in other cities or towns can retain their resident preference for the purpose of Inclusionary Housing. On a communication from Councillor Kelley requesting that this matter be forwarded to the 2018-2019 Legislative Session.
6. AR-17-22 : Report on the potential growth of next-generation wireless technology in the City, to include: the expected footprint of citywide coverage from just one company and what market competition might produce; the integration of public and private infrastructure to support the network; what local standards the City might hope to maintain relative to aesthetics and safety; and how this new technology fits into our Broadband access plans. On a communication from Councillor Kelley requesting that this matter be forwarded to the 2018-2019 Legislative Session.
7. AR-17-87 : Report on a schedule for resubmitting a revised draft of the Outdoor Lighting Ordinance that incorporates clearer wording and/or more clearly explains each section in less technical jargon and is more coherent in its entirety, with the goal of seeing such an Ordinance adopted by the end of this City Council term. On a communication from Councillor Kelley and Councillor Devereux requesting that this matter be forwarded to the 2018-2019 Legislative Session.
8. AR-18-6 : Report on information regarding electronic device usage by City-elected officials.
9. AR-18-15 : Report on any other relevant City Department to gain a sense of who is purchasing buildings in Cambridge.
10. AR-18-21 : Report on the feasibility of initiating a formal transit study and action plan of the Alewife area in response to unanimous concerns of the Envision Alewife Working Group.
11. AR-18-38 : Report on inventory of all City-owned vacant buildings and lots and the City's plans for them, if any.
12. AR-18-44 : Report on ensuring an additional commitment of $20 million from the City’s budget is devoted over the next five years toward the City’s efforts to preserve and create affordable housing units. ORAL REPORT PROVIDED

VERBAL RESPONSE AT FINANCE COMMITTEE HEARING HELD ON MAY 1, 2019 AND MAY 7, 2019

13. AR-18-53 : Report on an updated schedule for resubmitting a revised draft of the Outdoor Lighting Ordinance that incorporates suggestions from the Light Cambridge Committee by June 11, 2018.
14. AR-18-60 : Report on a small business parking pilot that would allow temporary on-street employee parking during typical daytime operating hours.
15. AR-18-66 : Report on establishing a Young Adult Civic Unity Committee to be modeled after the Citizen Civic Unity Committee and to recruit applicants from all across the community and across all socio-economic backgrounds.
16. AR-18-68 : Report on determining the permitting and legality issues of Peer-to-Peer Car Sharing in the City of Cambridge.
17. AR-18-73 : Report on establishing and implementing a dynamic new initiative that will seek to place Port residents (ages 18 and over) on paths to jobs with family-sustaining wages.
18. AR-18-83 : Report on an action plan to work with the City’s Community-Based Organizations to create a network of summertime evening programming to reduce the threat of violence in the City’s public spaces in 2019 and beyond.
19. AR-18-87 : Report on the navigational editing capabilities of the City of Cambridge.
20. AR-18-93 : Report on the sale of The Constellation Center's Parcel C in Kendall Square. REPORT RECEIVED AND ACCEPTED
21. AR-18-96 : Report on how the City views internet-based platforms as opportunities for outreach and communication and what sort of guidelines have been, or are being, developed to help everyone understand how the City’s various departments do or do not utilize these communication resources and how any communications on these platforms are managed so that the messaging and information is kept up-to-date.
22. AR-18-100 : Report on taking all possible immediate actions to preserve and restore Linear Park.
23. AR-18-108 : Report on offering early voting in City Council and School Committee Elections.
24. AR-18-119 : Report on evaluating the existing capacity of fire stations in the Kendall Square area and whether a new fire station is needed, and if so, determining the feasibility of locating a plot of land for this use.
25. AR-18-123 : Report on ensuring funding for our municipal media services. ORAL REPORT PROVIDED

VERBAL RESPONSE AT FINANCE COMMITTEE HEARING HELD ON MAY 1, 2019 AND MAY 7, 2019

26. AR-18-129 : Report on conducting a comprehensive, independent planning, and parking study of the neighborhood and use of the First Street Garage within 6months.
27. AR-18-130 : Report on working with the Chair of the Civic Unity Committee, the Director of the Cambridge Library, the Director of 22-CityView, the Director of the Women’s Commission, and any other appropriate City personnel to begin planning for a public discussion in recognition of 100 Years of Women’s Suffrage.
28. AR-18-134 : Report on creating a more inclusive city website, including an Open Meeting Portal registration form that does not require the use of gendered pronouns, salutations or titles.
29. AR-18-137 : Report on reviewing the FCC Regulations on Small Cell Technology.
30. AR-18-141 : Report on safe way to bring power to the curb and across sidewalks to power electric vehicles.
31. AR-19-2 : Report on allocating a percentage of hotel/motel tax revenue and adult use cannabis tax revenue to the arts in the FY20 budget. ORAL REPORT PROVIDED

VERBAL RESPONSE AT FINANCE COMMITTEE HEARING HELD ON MAY 1, 2019 AND MAY 7, 2019

32. AR-19-3 : Report on establishing a Central Square Improvement Fund and allocate no less than 25% of funds generated to the arts.
33. AR-19-4 : Report on the City's 1% for arts ordinance, which projects have met the threshold and which have fallen short, and whether it can be adjusted to account for ensuring that all mediums and disciplines of art, including live performance art, receive funding. ORAL REPORT PROVIDED

VERBAL RESPONSE AT FINANCE COMMITTEE HEARING HELD ON MAY 1, 2019 AND MAY 7, 2019

34. AR-19-5 : Report on how to provide public representation to the major project Selection Committees.
35. AR-19-7 : Report on Boston’s Electric Vehicle Charging Station Home Rule Petition and propose similar language for the City Council to consider.
36. AR-19-11 : Report on the feasibility of eliminating the use of plastic water bottles at City and School events.
37. AR-19-13 : Report on conferring with Eversource and the appropriate City departments to undertake a series of studies and analyses related to finance, health and safety, building design, and long-term electricity needs before the construction of a substation in East Cambridge.
38. AR-19-14 : Report on conducting inventories of both local arts organizations and private foundations that may support them.
39. AR-19-15 : Report on the possibility of setting up an assistance fund/program to help low-income and/or elderly/disabled residents manage bed bug infestations.
40. AR-19-16 : Report on the “Super Sunday” road race that was held on February 3, 2019 and if the proper procedures were followed in issuing permits and when/if the neighbors were notified.
41. AR-19-18 : Report on sharing regular project updates from the GSA and MITIMCO on the new Volpe Center.
42. AR-19-20 : Report on seeking additional funding for affordable housing concerns. ORAL REPORT PROVIDED

VERBAL RESPONSE AT FINANCE COMMITTEE HEARING HELD ON MAY 1, 2019 AND MAY 7, 2019

43. AR-19-21 : Report on the process for establishing a formal, thorough review of the City’s Affordable Home Ownership programs, incorporating a plan for obtaining and analyzing substantial quantitative data inclusive of all types of units.
44. AR-19-22 : Report on the feasibility of allowing small businesses to host live acoustic music performances without a license, and if feasible, present the City Council with a proposal to allow such performances.
45. AR-19-25 : Report on information that is offered to limited equity condominium owners regarding the ability to recoup extraordinary repair and maintenance costs, the procedure that is in place to inform purchasers of existing or possible construction and maintenance issues that may result in higher-than expected condo fees, and the possibility of allowing roommates to cover unexpected expenses.
46. AR-19-26 : Report on communicating directly with the Volpe Center about the possibility of having their staff help the City set up a Micro-Mobility Pilot program in the Kendall Square area.
47. AR-19-29 : Report on providing data on speed and vehicle counts on Garden Street between Concord Avenue and Linnaean Street and identify potential measures to improve its pedestrian and bicycle safety.
48. AR-19-32 : Report on the number of fines for failure to clear sidewalks issued from the winter of 2014-15 through the winter of 2018-19.
49. AR-19-33 : Report on updating the bike data count chart, along with other data tables and charts, in the Cambridge Bicycle Plan to reflect 2016 and 2018 data.
50. AR-19-34 : Report on how the data collected from the Broadway Eco-Display is used to inform the City’s transportation planning efforts and to address the possibility of installing additional Eco-Display counters at the highest trafficked bicycle locations to provide more comprehensive information about bike use and other vehicles such as scooters.
51. AR-19-35 : Report on the status of any micro-mobility pilot programs or partnerships in Cambridge.
52. AR-19-36 : Report on how the Parking and Transportation Demand Management Ordinance is being used anecdotally, what the participation rates and trends are, and how it’s administered.
53. AR-19-37 : Report on moving a Transit Benefit Ordinance proposal to an action plan.
54. AR-19-38 : Report on designating a staff member in the Economic Development Division as an "arts liaison." ORAL REPORT PROVIDED

VERBAL RESPONSE AT CITY COUNCIL MEETING HELD ON MAY 20, 2019

55. AR-19-39 : Report on creating a dedicated comprehensive "arts friendly" licensing web page.
56. AR-19-40 : Report on providing accessibility to the deaf community by hiring American Sign Language (ASL) interpreters and using apps such as Language Line Solutions to communicate with the deaf community in their first language.
57. AR-19-41 : Report on how Cambridge enforces moped registration requirements and the enforcement numbers. REPORT RECEIVED AND ACCEPTED
58. AR-19-42 : Report on plans this construction season to install sidewalk markings that appropriately indicate what types of mobility devices are allowed on which sidewalks.
59. AR-19-43 : Report on the types of vendor reporting programs that the City uses and how they are used as well as the ability to modify these programs given the constraints of relevant state and federal laws and similar limitations.
60. AR-19-44 : Report on installing more metered parking spots in business districts that do not currently have any.
61. AR-19-45 : Report on compiling a full accounting of streets, schools, and public buildings that may be named in honor of those who have ties to the American slave trade, and to work towards renaming all of these streets, schools, and buildings.
62. AR-19-46 : Report on reviewing whether the MBTA is out of compliance with the amended MBTA/BCIL settlement agreement through the delay in completion of the elevator replacement and concurrent hazardous condition of the stairwells related to Central Square.
63. AR-19-47 : Report on increasing traffic monitoring resources at the intersection of Prospect and Broadway, especially during morning rush hour. REPORT RECEIVED AND ACCEPTED
64. AR-19-48 : Report on working with the MBTA to do whatever is necessary to alleviate the Green Street bus idling and unhealthy situation.
65. AR-19-49 : Report on recommending restrictions on signage specific to retail establishments that sell e-cigarettes and other vaping devices.
66. AR-19-50 : Report on clarifying the policy around future installation of new LED street lights and replacement of failed 4000K LED street lights with warmer alternatives 3000K or less.
67. AR-19-51 : Report on determining whether an all-way stop sign, a raised intersection or other safety improvements would be helpful at the Garden/Field/Alpine intersection.
68. AR-19-53 : Report on working with the Cambridge Police Department and other relevant City staff on how media collected by hand-held photo/video recording devices is used, stored, and shared.
69. AR-19-54 : Report on how a cloud-based data management system for DHSP's Children and Youth Programs will clearly protect all aspects of participant privacy and access security.
70. AR-19-55 : Report on working with the Traffic, Parking and Transportation Department and the License Commission to establish a "play streets" permit.
71. AR-19-56 : Report on determining what facilities, parking changes, and other improvements to the pavement conditions would be necessary and feasible to make Massachusetts Avenue a quick-build Complete Street between Sidney Street and Putnam Avenue.
72. AR-19-57 : Report on establishing a partnership with the MBTA to offer CharlieCards at certain public buildings throughout the city.
73. AR-19-58 : Report on working with the Recycling Advisory Committee and other stakeholders to draft an ordinance banning single-use plastic items in Cambridge.
74. AR-19-59 : Report on exploring a pilot for Level 1 (110V) EV and Micromobility charging stations on street light poles throughout the city.
75. AR-19-60 : Report on adding a cybercrime assessment section to the list of monthly Bridgstat reports or, alternatively, create a separate report to help formalize the information flow about cybercrime to the same level as the currently used Bridgstat.
76. AR-19-61 : Report on potential ballot changes at a public hearing of the Government Operations, Rules and Claims Committee on May 28, 2019.
Adjournment
